revised_title: Experimental Researches in Electricity: Induction and Electro-Tonic State
tldr: The authors, Samuel Hunter Christie and John Bostock, investigate the induction of electricity in motion and discover the electro-tonic state, a unique condition in which a wire's state is only manifest upon interrupting or renewing the inducing circuit. They also demonstrate the connection between electricity and magnetism, providing evidence of electricity being produced by ordinary magnetism.
